comments.body: No, you can't return a legacy message from V2 provider and expect it to work, it will break horribly. Believe me, I've tried because Markdown stuff is pointless bull IMO.
That's surprising because the documentation states that you can. I don't think people will generally use v1 messages with the v2 provider, so I'll remove this.
Maybe I'm being wrong and confusing something with something else. Let me check.

Nope, pretty sure I'm right, at least judging by the quick look at the source code https://github.com/steelbrain/linter/blob/7d7e52625da118f51df73b5083d751a047effd44/lib/linter-registry.js#L126 -- linter version is being determined once on creation.
